com.isbx.locationtools.components

Class MyLocationComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.isbx.androidtools.utils.ActivityLifecycleListener
      • com.isbx.locationtools.components.MyLocationComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Application.ActivityLifecycleCallbacks, ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback, com.google.android.gms.common.api.GoogleApiClient.ConnectionCallbacks

    public class MyLocationComponent
extends ActivityLifecycleListener
implements ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback, com.google.android.gms.common.api.GoogleApiClient.ConnectionCallbacks
    This class to serves to simplify the common tasks of getting the user's current location and requesting recurring location updates.

    The standard approach to this problem is to connect to the Google API Client, request any necessary permissions from the user, then finally request the most recent location and/or start location updates. This leads to a lot of redundant code that gets rewritten every time you need to get the user's location in your app. This component simplifies the process by handling all of those steps internally as well as automatically handling lifecycle events in the case of recurring location updates.

    To retrieve the user's last known location, you would initialize the component and request the location: 

     MyLocationComponent locationComponent = new MyLocationComponent(this);
 locationComponent.getLastLocation(new LocationCallback() {
     @Override
     public void onLocationReceived(Location location) {
         // Handle location object
     }
 });

    To enable periodic location updates: 

     MyLocationComponent locationComponent = new MyLocationComponent(this);
 locationComponent.setLocationRequestOptions(priority, updateInterval, fastestUpdateInterval);
 locationComponent.setLocationUpdatesEnabled(true, locationListener);

    Note: You must through calls to onRequestPermissionsResult(int, String[], int[]) from your Activity or Fragment in order for automatic permissions checking to work on API >= 6.0.

      • getLastLocation

        public void getLastLocation(LocationCallback callback)
        Retrieves the user's most recent known location and passes it to callback. If the api client is currently connected and the app has the necessary location permissions, the callback should execute immediately. Otherwise, the necessary connection and permission operations will continue asynchronously and invoke the callback when they have completed.
        Parameters:
        callback - A LocationCallback to be notified of the user's last location

      • getLastLocation

        public Location getLastLocation()
        Returns the user's last known location if available.
        Returns:
        The last known Location, or null if the api client is not connected or location permissions have not been granted
        See Also:
        getLastLocation(LocationCallback)

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Returns the connection state of the internal GoogleApiClient.
        Returns:
        true if the client is connected, false otherwise

      • registerConnectionCallbacks

        public void registerConnectionCallbacks(com.google.android.gms.common.api.GoogleApiClient.ConnectionCallbacks callbacks)
        Register additional callbacks to be notified of the internal GoogleApiClient's connection events.
        Parameters:
        callbacks - A GoogleApiClient.ConnectionCallbacks instance

      • setBackgroundLocationUpdatesEnabled

        public void setBackgroundLocationUpdatesEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether periodic location updates should continue to run in the background. Enabling this will increase the resource consumption of your app and can contribute to battery drain if not used carefully. This has no effect if location updates have not been enabled via setLocationUpdatesEnabled(boolean, LocationListener). Defaults to false.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if location updates should continue to run when the app is in the background, false otherwise
        See Also:
        setLocationUpdatesEnabled(boolean, LocationListener)

      • setLocationUpdatesEnabled

        public void setLocationUpdatesEnabled(boolean enabled,
                                      com.google.android.gms.location.LocationListener locationListener)
        Sets whether this component should request periodic location updates. If enabled, locationListener will receive the updated Location objects.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if location updates should be enabled, false otherwise
        locationListener - A LocationListener to be notified of the periodic location updates
        See Also:
        setLocationRequestOptions(int, long, long), FusedLocationProviderApi.requestLocationUpdates(GoogleApiClient, LocationRequest, LocationListener)

      • setLocationRequestOptions

        public void setLocationRequestOptions(int priority,
                                      long interval,
                                      long minInterval)
        Specifies the location request parameters that will be used to request periodic updates. This has no effect if location updates have not been enabled via setLocationUpdatesEnabled(boolean, LocationListener).
        Parameters:
        priority - A hint to the location client on how accurate the updates should be. Must be one of LocationRequest.PRIORITY_HIGH_ACCURACY, LocationRequest.PRIORITY_BALANCED_POWER_ACCURACY, LocationRequest.PRIORITY_LOW_POWER, or LocationRequest.PRIORITY_NO_POWER.
        interval - The desired interval for active location updates, in milliseconds
        minInterval - The fastest interval for location updates, in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        LocationRequest.setPriority(int), LocationRequest.setInterval(long), LocationRequest.setFastestInterval(long)

      • startLocationUpdates

        protected void startLocationUpdates()
        Performs permission request if necessary and starts location updates using the parameters set by setLocationRequestOptions(int, long, long) and the LocationListener set by setLocationUpdatesEnabled(boolean, LocationListener).

      • stopLocationUpdates

        public void stopLocationUpdates()
        Cancels periodic location updates for this component.
        See Also:
        resumeLocationUpdates()

      • resumeLocationUpdates

        public void resumeLocationUpdates()
        Starts location updates if not already running.
        See Also:
        stopLocationUpdates()
